column3: Sir James Paul McCartney (born 18 June 1942) is a singer-songwriter multi-instrumentalist and composer. He gained worldwide fame as the bass guitarist and singer for the rock band the Beatles widely considered the most popular and influential group in the history of popular music. His songwriting partnership with John Lennon remains the most successful in history. After the group disbanded in 1970 he pursued a solo career and formed the band Wings with his first wife Linda and Denny Laine.

John Winston Ono Lennon (9 October 1940 â€“ 8 December 1980) was an English singer songwriter and peace activist who co-founded the Beatles. Lennon revealed a rebellious nature and acerbic wit in his music writing drawings on film and in interviews. Some of his songs were adopted as anthems by the anti-war movement and the larger counterculture. Lennon was voted eighth in a BBC poll of the 100 Greatest Britons and in 2008 Rolling Stone ranked him the fifth-greatest singer of all time. In 1987 he was posthumously inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame.
